author: Yaman Agarwal
description:
In this video, we will make 2 types of Dosa and Idli Chutneys, these chutneys or pachadis are very famous as accompaniments for South Indian Delicacies like Dosa, Idly, Vada, Pesarattu, Vada, Bhajji etc. 

Watch my Sambar Recipe here - https://goo.gl/544aVi
Watch my Rava Idli here - https://goo.gl/oiJgH8

Ingredients:
Coconut Chutney:
Nariyal - 1 (medium size, peeled & diced)
Puffed Chana Dal - ½ cup
Curry Leaves - 1 sprig
Green Chili - 2
Ginger - 1/2 inch
Salt - as per taste
Cumin - 1 tsp
Yogurt - 2 tbsp
Water - 2 tbsp
Coriander leaves - handful 

For Takda
Oil - 1 tbsp
Mustard seeds/sarso - 1 tsp
Urad dal - ½ tsp
Hing/Asafoetida - 1 pinch
Curry Leaf - 4-5
Turmeric - ¼ tsp
Whole red chili - 2
--
Peanut Chutney:
Peanut / Groundnut - ½ cup
Coconut - 1 tbsp
Salt -  as per taste
Whole Red Chili - 6
Garlic cloves - 5
Cumin seeds - ½ tsp
Tamarind pulpP. - 2 tbsp
Water - ½ cup

For tadka
Oil - 1 tbsp
Mustard seeds/Sarso - 1 tsp
Urad dal - ½ tsp
Whole red chili - 2
Curry leaves - 4-5
Turmeric - ¼ tsp
Jaggery - 1 tsp


Website: http://www.cookingshooking.com | http://www.cookingshooking.in
Fb: http://www.fb.com/cookingshooking
Blog: http://www.cooknshook.blogspot.com
keywords: accompaniment, coconut chutney recipe, idli dosa chutney, peanut chutney recipe, south indian coconut chutney
name: 2 Dosa Chutneys Recipe – Nariyal and Peanut Chutney for Idli – CookingShooking
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup or any one roasted chana / cashewnut / peanut Puffed Chana Dal

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixer grinder jar, combine coconut, curry leaves, cumin, ginger, green chili and salt.
Next add puffed chana dal, water and coriander leaves. Blend everything until you get a paste like consistency. Add water if required.
Add yogurt and give it a good stir, and transfer the coconut chutney in a bowl.
Heat a tadka pan or a small pan over medium flame; add oil and then the mustard seeds, urad dal and hing. Allow it to crackle.
Add the curry leaves, turmeric powder and finally the whole red chili. Allow everything to crackle.
Add the tadka to the coconut chutney, and give it a light mix. Your coconut chutney is ready.
